attributes.action: Emergency Resettlement in UK for Syrian Refugees following the Earthquake
attributes.additional_details:
Syrian nationals have suffered greatly due to ongoing conflict under the Assad regime, and have now been affected by a terrible natural disaster. State media in Syria said the death toll in government-held areas had risen to 1,347, up from 1,262. White Helmets civil defence group said another 1,930 deaths had been reported in rebel-held areas in the north-west of the country.
Syrians are deserving of support which they may not be able to access in their country.
attributes.background: Launch a Resettlement Scheme for vulnerable Syrian nationals which have lost their livelihoods, homes and families following the 7.8 magnitude earthquake which hit Syrian and Turkiye.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/632816
